Summary I am a versatile professional that never shies away from challenges. I learn fast: in fact learning and embracing or driving change has become my only constant to accommodate my life-style and career. 
 
When leading a project, I dig as deep as needed to drive technical projects to success. I get things done and I try to do so in an efficient way, which often take roots in my technical abilities in order to automate tasks and facilitate coordination. 
 
Whenever I lack business/product knowledge on a new area, or need to confirm assumptions, I apply data driven approaches. From data, I am able to extract insights and take rational and hopefully right decisions. 
 
Finally, taking advantage from both technical expertise and business insights, I facilitate communication between all interested parties in order to stay focus on our target: delight our users. 
 
My middle term goal is to take command of/create a product as a Product Manager and deliver to the market IT products to make life easier for millions of users. 
 
Myself in bullet points: 
• Challenge-taker and results-oriented with interest in IT/new media/social media  
• Adaptable and fast learner used to working under loose guidelines in fast paced environments 
• Excellent communicator with experience addressing clients and top management as well as training peers  
• Organized project manager with strong data-driven approach to ensure projects success  
• Previous software developer at ease managing/negotiating technical projects

Experience Product Lead, Google Life Sciences Google December 2013  – Present (1 year 8 months) Member Board Of Directors Lewa Wildlife Conservancy May 2014  – Present (1 year 3 months) Product Lead for the Android Developer Ecosystem Open Handset Alliance | Google Android December 2012  –  January 2014  (1 year 2 months) Headed up Android’s developer ecosystem product strategy. Part of the M&A team responsible for the successful integration of operations on Google side with two acquisitions: Zaves & TxVia. 
 
Co-led the Associate Technology Manager program which included college recruiting, mentoring, & running classes. Lectured at NYU on mobile technology. Business Development Engineer Dailymotion USA July 2009  –  April 2011  (1 year 10 months) Video-sharing website Dailymotion is ranked the 32nd most-visited website worldwide. At Dailymotion US, I:  
 
- Work as a facilitator between the French and American teams for product requirements, technical implementations (up to coding the features myself) and business development.

- Lead technical relationships for batch content ingestion (from MRSS feeds) for Vevo, Grab Networks, 5Min, Crackle, etc. 
 
- Work as a product/project manager and developer on a cross-continent project to develop the Flash video player (PHP 5, Actionscript 3). 
- Handle partner relationships for 3rd-party reporting tools (Tubemogul, Visible Measures) and for in-stream advertising with Auditude. 
 
- Oversee open-source project relationships such as Universal Subtitles (http://universalsubtitles.org/en/) for player API improvements. 
- Oversee the business development on connected devices in the US such as VUDU, Samsung, Panasonic, etc. 
 
- Led the launch of the IPTV service on Google TV 
- Led the launch of the Dailymotion Stream App on the Google Chrome Web Store: http://dai.ly/chrome-app 
 
- Led the Bit.ly implementation of their API through the delegation of the short URL: dai.ly 
 
- Attended many conferences: Open Video Conf., Intel Developer Conf., CES, SXSW, Facebook F8, IE9 Beta launch
